intro: Aphananthe philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters. Aphananthe philippinensis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
